title: Support Ashe -- Don't hate me
body:
So I recently played support Ashe yesterday. I called it from the start the minute I saw the enemy team choose Thresh. I just got bombarded with 'OMFG PLEASE NO", "AFK", "Choose a real support or dodge queue". Keep in mind that every other position was called and I told them that it wasn't my first time doing it, I've done it multiple times with success in Normal. The twitch jungle was just icing on the cake.

Every lane won, and we eventually were just able to push every lane to inhibitors. But at the end of the game, the team was like "lucky top and mid won or else bot would lost it for us"....It's as if arrows across the map securing a kill for Rumble twice and Syndra once wasn't helpful.

Point: Why do people hate Ashe as adc AND support? She offers so much utility against non healing support comps.

replies.body: Guaranteed consistent slow, global stun, long range vision, plus ranged harass? Not your typical support, but still not bad. Lots of fun too, and honestly, (support main) Ashe ADC's have been the best ADC I've worked with.
Ashe teaches great mechanics.  Frost Archers represent!

As a support main also, if I see someone choose Ashe as one of the first 3 picks for the team, I'm usually in awe of how good they are. Not only gameplay-wise, but they communicate so much better. It's great to know that you have an ADC who knows when to initiate and disengage.

+1 Support Ashe! But ADC is so much better
I love Ashe
How do you build ashe support?

Zeke's, Greaves, Sightstone are crucial on her. Normally I also go IE, Talisman, and then either Locket or Crucible, but if you don't want to be 'as supportive' you might trade the Locket/Crucible for BT or if you have someone like a Sivir ADC trading the talisman for a BT also works. I find that supp Ashe with a Talisman makes her relatively safe though because she has decent MS.

The way I really think of building Ashe support though is 'Do we need tower push or do we need utility?' The first 3 items I listed are items I try to get for her during laning phase, after laning it's more of a decision as to if we're lacking in utility (shields/heals) to keep people alive during the fights, or if our problem is after the fights pushing towers. If it's the towers we need I'll often go for a more damage heavy build so that it's easier for us to clean up a teamfight, and we have more tower pushing power.
This exactly!

I find it a lot of fun myself. I usually manage to do that once or twice with friends, works most of the time barring a jungle camp.

However, it is not a comfortable pick for randoms for 2 reasons.

1) They more than likely have not used it or seen it done with any success prior, if they had seen it at all. It's rare you will find someone who has seen it consistently do well, so there's going to be a stigma.

2) It's not as reliable as normal supports. Ashe, even support, is squishy with no real escapes and one hard cc (even if it is the longest duration in the game with some distance). Obviously a good Ashe support will still be better than a bad, say, Thresh. But in this world of flash, blinks and dashes on almost every champ the one main thing you get out of Ashe (constant, reliable slow) simply doesn't do as much.

Have you tried Team Builder? It's always a good tool for champs in rarely seen roles.

I tried Ashe support but I wasn't a fan, for a few reason:

1. When arrow is on cooldown you have little peel for your carries. Sure you have a slow, that's not gonna do too much against gap closer popular picks like Khazix, Leesin etc. 

2. Your harass is weak as you can't afford to build a meaningful amount of ad.

I think it tends to either work quite well, or very horribly :P It depends on your team. If you're behind, an Ashe support isn't going to turn any tides, but if you're even/slightly ahead, it can work out okay. I just think there are better picks. If you take her for the stun, why not a Morgana/Zyra who have skillshot roots on much lower cooldowns? With build in utility/harass included.

TL;DR - I'm not saying its the worst support idea in the world, but there are just better alternatives :) Well done on trying new stuff though I'm always a fan of breaking the meta.

Ashe support is nice if you're one of the last pick. Like the OP said, she picked Ashe support because she saw the thresh. Ashe support doesn't work very well against heavy gapcloser teams, but Ashe support is normally very successful if the enemy pulling all the weight is a melee bruiser like Darius or Garen or Shyv who might have some mobility buffs but are very susceptible to Ashe's kiting.

If you're in a no heal botlane and you can keep even at the beginning of laning Ashe supp with a Zeke's rush often puts your lane out on top because you have more damage and more sustain than the enemy laners at that point.

Edit:
Ashe has been a secondary support for quite a while, Riot officially lists her on the same support level as Leona, and peple have been playing Ashe support for a long time. Ashe support really isn't anything 'New'.

Agreed on this whole post.

I wouldn't choose Ashe support under any definite circumstances. I prefer my poke supports, but I find that vs Thresh or Braum or Morgana, it's just so easy to get farmed up without risking anything. Sure there won't be any kills in lane, but that works out in Ashe's favor.

If they have a single blinker, I won't consider it. If they have 1 or 2 dashers, it's still viable.

Ashe actually has good kill potential given the right lane, but the biggest advantage to Ashe support is the tower push. You don't *have* to kill them. All you need to do is push them out of lane 1 time after level 3/4 and the ADC/Ashe should be able to clean up the tower giving your team more objective control around baron and if your ADC is smart they should be able to freeze the lane close to their turret so that they can still continue to farm. Very few supports have the early game tower push that Ashe does because she's AD instead of AP.

I normally would go with Morgana, she's just the safest support to use for engage and protection outside of Janna. But Zyra is very easy to outplay and I consider her a disengage support more than anything. She pokes well, but after using her root and ult, if someone was able to dodge those, she knows that she's dead. With Ashe, there's still a chance.

Also no support can scout like Ashe, and she receives extra gold per minion kill if you absolutely need to clear a wave from turret.

Ashe + Quinn is one of the most ungankable botlanes next to any ADC + Janna. If you have a smart Quinn and a smart Ashe you always have vision everywhere.

I definitely prefer Janna over Morg though. I know I'm giving up damage (I actually build Janna with exactly 0 AP), but my Janna is a lot tankier (2.75k hp, 41hp per5, ~200armor, ~150mr, locket shield, crucible heal, etc) than my Morgana and she just has so much more control over the battlefield. Janna is definitely my favorite support right now and she's so much harder to counter than Morg. I think the only support I have problem laning against as Janna right now is Soraka just because she can be pretty passive with her overall healing nature, she doesn't really get in range of the knockup, and Soraka is just going to outsustain you in this passive aggressive farm and outsustain/damage lane.

Well, she's the only support other than GP that could conceivably build a {{item:3050}}  and not feel bad about it. What gold item do you take? {{item:3303}} would work well with volleys, but the AP probably won't do much for Ashe outside of her ult, as well as {{item:3092}} active being redundant with Ashe. {{item:3301}} would give nice sustain to volley more, but with less gold income.
I liked Talisman and Mobi boots on Ashe; gives you some much needed mobility

I go with Ancient Coin. When I use Ashe, the aim is to be the long range initiator and teamfight protector for my ADC. So I'll usually stand behind everyone, Ult, and if it hits, activate Coin and attack. It has less gold income, which sucks, but it guarantees gold minus going spellthief and risking their support out damaging you.

Maybe I'm just bad, but I like getting {{item:3050}} on the melee supports when I have multiple AA based AD champs on my team (like mid Tristana).

And, on the topic of whether to get Ancient Coin or Spellthief's, I get Spellthief's and either don't upgrade it, or only upgrade it to the second tier Frostfang. Endgame full build switch to third tier Talisman.

My theory on Ashe support (I don't actually play her) is to start with {{item:3303}}  for the gold and bonus damage and poke all day.  Never upgrade it tho, you don't get much out of the stats.  Instead you move onto AD/Support items and sell Spelltheifs later when you need the room.

It's not ashe support.  Bad players trick themselves into believing the meta is required to win....but the meta is more like a "best circumstances" guide. Its not guranateed. Its not fact. It's not 100%. Player skill, enemy inexperience, team composition, team synergy, ability to take objectives, laning knowledge and trade knowledge are all parts of the game.

Now was this normals? Because if so then that's even worse because its ...normals. I could see getting irritated in ranked, only if i used na.op.gg to find out that person trying to "break the meta' was a consistent feeder and had a low win rate. But if i look and the dude seems to have a clue what he's doing then i won't say a word because you need to trust your teammates.

But really its sad to hear kids cry about the meta in normals when i carry with adc ahri ffs.

It was in Ranked. And I'm confident on my Ashe skills as ADC and support, so I see no difference in doing well with her. I expect people to oppose the idea, but the hell they were saying. It was like...would YOU like to support??? Then assume I'll do "okay" and you carry the game.

Ashe is just not meta, which is why people don't like her. It's pretty silly, if you play her well you can beat any bandwagon Lucian player out there, same is true for any champion. She's pretty devastating as a poke support imo (guarunteed crits and AoE harrass + perma slows, not to mention her ult lets her initiate from anywhere on the map, I've stolen dragons with it).

Basically she's not bad, but she's generally outclassed by other champions in most situations. Caitlyn has longer range and better zone control with her traps, in addition to mobility that Ashe lacks, which is pretty huge in the mobility meta. The global engage is pretty nice, but engages have tended to fall on Support or Top/Jungle, where supports like Nami also have long range engage and disengage, in addition to a lot more utility.

There's also the stereotype that she's a beginner champion, similar to how people hate on Annie/Ryze mid, Garen top, etc, even though they can be pretty powerful if played well and in the right situation.
You can get away with Ashe support in low elo.. and it would work pretty good too.. cuz low elo players dont know how to punish but imo, Ashe is like a inferior version of Sona with no sustain..

I've been using Ashe Support in Gold for a few weeks now without a loss, granted that's only 7 games, but my normals record with it is a lot larger. Sona is a good sustain champ, but her poke is situational (she can't attack through minions) and her autos are weak without spamming first. Her ult is stronger in range, but with Ashe, there is no limit and when you can initiate or if you are too close for comfort. Also Sona's slow would only work to lose her passive for it's damage.

Early game Ashe has more peel than sona, though Sona offers the sustain. Ashe can prevent ganks a lot more effectively (with scouting and long ranged slows) and she can take at turret faster.

Sona fits the scenario of use the majority of the time. But I have never had difficulty ruining a Sona's laning phase.
Sona **can** attack through minions and I believe Ashe volley can be blocked by minions... Sona's Q cannot be blocked... But I do agree that Ashe can help take down towers more than Sona

{{champion:22}} is an extremely niche champion (not a bad thing at all) who's very dependent on a good comp to function properly, which is why in SoloQ people tend to see her as weak. Although she is by no means bad and offers a ton of utility, parts of her kit are outdated (her perma-slow is weak against gapclosers) and her extreme squishiness makes the laning phase extremely unstable when she's either a marksman or a support. If you can play her confidently without putting yourself or your lane partner at risk, don't be afraid to try her out.

Okay you can play Ashe support all you want and you can be good at it, but people mistake "not meta' for "optimal'.

Renekton top may not be "meta" right now but it is still a complete beast.

Ashe support isn't meta or optimal (nor that good anyway), recognize that and try to play your best in the game to impress your allies anyway. But in the end all you have is someone that kinda slows well with an global ulti, your better off playing Ashe mid and making her another carry. Which isn't meta but still optimal.
I played Support Ashe once (But my lane partner wasn't an ADC..it was a Warwick) and we completely roflstomped the enemy bot lane....10/10 do recommend.

#FixAshe

She needs either a small rework, or a complete rework.  Either that, or some kind of buff somewhere.

One day, when I have IP to spare, I will build an entire rune page with [+ Crit Damage] runes and go Support Ashe, so I can basically do one autoattack every few seconds that is much like a Karma poke but undodgeable and mana-free. I will start Spellthief's Edge, then get Sightstone, boots, then get a single selfish item (IE) and then build traditional support items (Locket, Twin Shadows, Mikael's, whatever's needed).

The biggest issue I see with her is that she's squishy. At least when she's ADC the point is to keep her safe. But I support often and honestly, a good support (imo) bully's physically. Ashe brings a great kit certainly, but if the enemy team decides to go in for the kill, there's not much she's going to be able to do about it. I think when we look at something like Ashe support it's too easy to fall into the trap of the dummy-enemy.

They're going to have their own CC, their own flash, their own steroids, and I feel like once Ult's are up and in use, never mind when CDR comes into play, she operates far more efficiently. You'd need to have a really early game. So maybe she works with Draven or someone who's going to blow people up early. But it's the same concept as support Pantheon. Go in for the early snowball and if it fails, come up with some new strat.

Ashe as and adc is considered predictable and weak versus mobile initiators. You can rarely see them using the ult properly to initiate a fight, they either miss it trying to secure a kill or shoot it point blank. Also she trades some of ther lategame damage for the slows and utility and has quite a weak passive. 
About support ashe I think people just don't want to take risks with strategies tat they don't know is working
